tags: i can imagine this quite well
summary:
Jon: Are you upset you don't get to be on the same training team as Arya?
Gendry: Have you ever trained with Arya?
Jon:...
body:
Jon: Are you upset you don’t get to be on the same training team as Arya?

Gendry: Have you ever trained with Arya?

Jon: No

Gendry: Have you ever gone into a steel cage with wolverine?

*cuts to Arya and Pod*

Arya [to Podrick]: FASTER! FASTER! FASTER! FASTER! DO YOU NOT KNOW THAT WORD?! IT MEANS MORE FAST!

summary: GOT S8 Teaser: What can we observe in this teaser? Jon, walking past Lyanna’s statue.  Voiceover reminds us of a Stark pledge to...
body:
GOT S8 Teaser: What can we observe in this teaser?

Jon, walking past Lyanna’s statue.  Voiceover reminds us of a Stark pledge to PROTECT Jon from ambitious, ruthless monarchs.   

Sansa, walking past her mother’s statue.  Voiceover reminds us of Catelyn’s grief over her (show invention) inability to LOVE Jon, suggesting Sansa will correct her mother’s regret.  

Jon, walking past the statue of the man who raised him. Voiceover reminds us that Jon is a STARK.  

Three Starks gather in front of their own statues, reminded of their own mortality. A threat grows, extinguishing the fire Jon was clinging to.  Three Starks turn to face the threat.  

We know a fight is coming.  The freezing air that approaches is coming for them.  But it’s is coming for them not on the battlefield, or on the ramparts.  It’s coming for them in the crypts.  The place where thousands of years of Starks are buried. Make no mistake, this is a STARK fight.  It’s a fight they’ve fought before.  The secret to fighting it again lies not in a fiery outsider.  The secret to this fight is written in the crypts, in the very bones of the Starks.

I smell my wolf, I smell her fur, almost as if she were still beside me.

summary:
Yon Rha: A real wolf would finish a wounded animal.
Katara: Maybe some real wolves will find you. Maybe they'll smell you when...
body:
Yon Rha: A real wolf would finish a wounded animal.
Katara: Maybe some real wolves will find you. Maybe they'll smell you when the sun goes down. Then you would learn what wolves do to dogs.

summary: arya underfoot is the best asoiaf sobriquet because it represents arya’s close relationship with the people of winterfell as an...
body:
arya underfoot is the best asoiaf sobriquet because it represents arya’s close relationship with the people of winterfell as an equal. they gave her that nickname because she was always soooo close to them - literally underfoot. arya eagerly and openly befriends people no matter what class they happened to be born into 

which is how it should be

tags: i didn’t know what else to put
summary:
Jon: So, how’s Gendry? 
Arya: Well, last week he was supposed to make some horseshoes, but instead he made animal biscuit...
body:
Jon: So, how’s Gendry?

Arya: Well, last week he was supposed to make some horseshoes, but instead he made animal biscuit cutters. Now everything we eat is shaped like either a bull’s head or a wolf. He’s so stupid. I love him.

summary:
Some thoughts on where the stark kids + dany end up post s8
Jon is always distant, always cold. He saw death and now he can't go...
body:
Some thoughts on where the stark kids + dany end up post s8

  • Jon is always distant, always cold. He saw death and now he can’t go back, back to his own life. So he goes to the wall instead, taking a number of night’s watchman and wildlings with him, and becomes the lord comander once again. The scars on his chest never heal.
  • Arya never ages. She’s stuck at the age of 16, and she never gets older, never appears to grow. She outlives all her family, and starts to wander the world. Eventully she forgets her name and she becomes no one.
  • Bran never gets his emotions back. He stays the same, cold and distant, apart from his family. He journeys north, past the broken shell of the wall, and goes to his place as the three eyed raven.
  • Sansa tries to lock her emotions away, trying to make herself cold and distent, like jon. She still has nightmares, every night, of the war, of all the people who died. She bonds with theon, because of what happened to them, and he becomes her dearest friend. After jon leaves for the wall, she becomes queen in the north.
  • After the death of cersei, Daenreys becomes queen. She realises that she doesn’t like ruling, that she hates staying in the same place, doing the same, day after day. So leaves a few of her trusted advisors in charge, and leaves with her last dragon, rhaegal. She never comes back.

  • Arya never ages. She’s stuck at the age of 16, and she never gets older, never appears to grow. She outlives all her family, and starts to wander the world. Eventully she forgets her name and she becomes no one.
  • Bran never gets his emotions back. He stays the same, cold and distant, apart from his family. He journeys north, past the broken shell of the wall, and goes to his place as the three eyed raven.
  • Sansa tries to lock her emotions away, trying to make herself cold and distent, like jon. She still has nightmares, every night, of the war, of all the people who died. She bonds with theon, because of what happened to them, and he becomes her dearest friend. After jon leaves for the wall, she becomes queen in the north.
  • After the death of cersei, Daenreys becomes queen. She realises that she doesn’t like ruling, that she hates staying in the same place, doing the same, day after day. So leaves a few of her trusted advisors in charge, and leaves with her last dragon, rhaegal. She never comes back.

  • Arya never ages. She’s stuck at the age of 16, and she never gets older, never appears to grow. She outlives all her family, and starts to wander the world. Eventully she forgets her name and she becomes no one.
  • Bran never gets his emotions back. He stays the same, cold and distant, apart from his family. He journeys north, past the broken shell of the wall, and goes to his place as the three eyed raven.
  • Sansa tries to lock her emotions away, trying to make herself cold and distent, like jon. She still has nightmares, every night, of the war, of all the people who died. She bonds with theon, because of what happened to them, and he becomes her dearest friend. After jon leaves for the wall, she becomes queen in the north.
  • After the death of cersei, Daenreys becomes queen. She realises that she doesn’t like ruling, that she hates staying in the same place, doing the same, day after day. So leaves a few of her trusted advisors in charge, and leaves with her last dragon, rhaegal. She never comes back.
trail.content:
Some thoughts on where the stark kids + dany end up post s8

  • Jon is always distant, always cold. He saw death and now he can’t go back, back to his own life. So he goes to the wall instead, taking a number of night’s watchman and wildlings with him, and becomes the lord comander once again. The scars on his chest never heal.
  • Arya never ages. She’s stuck at the age of 16, and she never gets older, never appears to grow. She outlives all her family, and starts to wander the world. Eventully she forgets her name and she becomes no one.
  • Bran never gets his emotions back. He stays the same, cold and distant, apart from his family. He journeys north, past the broken shell of the wall, and goes to his place as the three eyed raven.
  • Sansa tries to lock her emotions away, trying to make herself cold and distent, like jon. She still has nightmares, every night, of the war, of all the people who died. She bonds with theon, because of what happened to them, and he becomes her dearest friend. After jon leaves for the wall, she becomes queen in the north.
  • After the death of cersei, Daenreys becomes queen. She realises that she doesn’t like ruling, that she hates staying in the same place, doing the same, day after day. So leaves a few of her trusted advisors in charge, and leaves with her last dragon, rhaegal. She never comes back.

tags: i have very little hope but i’m hoping to be pleasantly surprised
summary: When at last she slept, she dreamed of home. The kingsroad wound its way past Winterfell on its way to the Wall, and Yoren had...
body:
When at last she slept, she dreamed of home. The kingsroad wound its way past Winterfell on its way to the Wall, and Yoren had promised he’d leave her there with no one any wiser about who she‟d been. She yearned to see her mother again, and Robb and Bran and Rickon … but it was Jon Snow she thought of most. She wished somehow they could come to the Wall before Winterfell, so Jon might muss up her hair and call her “little sister.” She‟d tell him, “I missed you,” and he‟d say it too at the very same moment, the way they always used to say things together. She would have liked that. She would have liked that better than anything.

D&D has one hell of a reunion to live up to.

reblog.comment:

She would have liked that. She would have liked that better than anything.

D&D has one hell of a reunion to live up to.

She would have liked that. She would have liked that better than anything.

D&D has one hell of a reunion to live up to.
